title: 'World-class' Sam Underhill and Tom Curry breaking the mould of traditional openside flankers
text:
Two of the game’s most distinguished flankers, Peter Winterbottom of England and Wales’ Martyn Williams, believe that Sam Underhill and Tom Curry will be entirely at home on a red carpet parade of back-row talent at the Oita Stadium when they step into the spotlight along with Wallaby duo, David Pocock and Michael Hooper.

The young English pairing want for nothing even though they are mere rookies compared to the Australians who have been at the forefront of the world game for the past decade, nuggety, influential, irrepressible. The Australians have 180 caps between them. Underhill and Curry a mere 28. The gulf is one of statistics not one of class.

“Underhill looked the part even as a youngster,”...
description: Two of the game’s most distinguished flankers, Peter Winterbottom of England and Wales’ Martyn Williams, believe that Sam Underhill and Tom Curry will be entirely at home on a red carpet parade of back-row talent at the Oita Stadium when they step into the spotlight along with Wallaby duo, David Pocock and Michael Hooper.
